abstract: Wells Fargo reported a $2.55 billion loss for its fourth quarter on Wednesday, as the bank’s profits were weighed down by mortgage assets it assumed when it took over Wachovia weeks ago.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo reported a $2.55 billion loss for its fourth quarter on Wednesday, as the bank’s profits were weighed down by mortgage assets it assumed when it took over Wachovia weeks ago.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Takes 4th-Quarter Loss on Wachovia Deal

abstract: The $2.55 billion fourth-quarter loss is a sign that the acquisition of Wachovia was the start of a long struggle.
snippet: The $2.55 billion fourth-quarter loss is a sign that the acquisition of Wachovia was the start of a long struggle.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo reported a $2.55 billion fourth-quarter loss on Wednesday in the first signs that its hurried acquisition of the troubled Wachovia Corporation would be a long and difficult struggle.

headline.main: Wachovia Acquisition Drags Down Wells Fargo
headline.print_headline: Wachovia Acquisition Drags Down Wells Fargo

byline.original: By ERIC DASH and MICHAEL DE LA MERCED

abstract: Wells Fargo, which reported a $2.55 billion loss on Wednesday, said it wrote off $294 million in the fourth quarter because some of its customers were wiped out by the disgraced financier Bernard L. Madoff’s reputed $50 billion Ponzi scheme and were unable to pay their loans.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo, which reported a $2.55 billion loss on Wednesday, said it wrote off $294 million in the fourth quarter because some of its customers were wiped out by the disgraced financier Bernard L. Madoff’s reputed $50 billion Ponzi scheme and were unable to pay their loans.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Says Madoff Scheme Cost It $294 Million
